 Massachusetts doesn't marry out of state gays, due to a 100 year old law designed to prevent out of state mixed-race couples from getting married there. It hasn't been used for decades, but the governor has decided it applies here, and has ordered that no licenses be issued to out of state gay couples. So we either need to see that law overturned, or have a Mass. couple decide to move to another state. Then the legal trek to the Supreme Court will start. Having just won the right to get married I'm guessing that not many couples are eager to move to another state and have that right denied to them again.
